heroIntro: Welcome to an exceptional opportunity to acquire a distinguished 4-bedroom villa in Portixol, Javea—one of the Costa Blanca's most coveted residential enclaves. Priced at €2,900,000, this exclusive property represents compelling value within Javea's luxury market, where comparable properties command €3,200/m² on average. This villa embodies the sophisticated lifestyle sought by discerning international buyers: unobstructed sea views, prime Mediterranean positioning, and proximity to world-class amenities. Javea has established itself as the preferred destination for affluent expatriates and investors seeking authentic Spanish coastal elegance without the commercial overdevelopment of neighbouring resorts. The Portixol neighbourhood epitomizes this exclusivity, offering a refined community of like-minded residents who appreciate privacy, quality architecture, and the authentic charm of the Costa Blanca. With the region experiencing consistent 6% year-on-year appreciation, this property presents both a prestigious residence and a sound investment opportunity in one of Spain's most stable property markets.
areaSection: Javea, officially Xàbia, is a picturesque coastal municipality on the northern Costa Blanca, characterized by dramatic limestone cliffs, secluded coves, and a Mediterranean climate of 300+ annual sunshine days. Located 100km northeast of Alicante, the town has evolved from a fishing village into an exclusive residential destination while maintaining its authentic Spanish character. The geography is distinctive: three distinct peninsulas create natural harbours and multiple beaches ranging from sandy stretches to intimate pebbly coves. The surrounding Sierra de Bernia mountains provide a dramatic backdrop and mitigate summer heat. Javea's elevation and coastal position create superior weather compared to inland Costa Blanca areas, with cooler summers and milder winters. The region benefits from excellent infrastructure—modern roads, reliable utilities, and efficient healthcare—while preserving natural beauty and avoiding the mass-tourism congestion of larger resorts. This balance has made Javea the preferred choice for wealthy Europeans seeking permanent residence or holiday homes.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Javea centers on unhurried Mediterranean rhythms combined with sophisticated international amenities. The established British, German, and Dutch expatriate communities have created a cosmopolitan environment where English is widely spoken and international standards are met across healthcare, education, and services. Morning rituals might include coffee at waterfront cafés overlooking the harbour, where local fishing boats operate alongside private yachts. The weekly markets deliver fresh Mediterranean produce, seafood, and regional specialities, while international supermarkets cater to specific dietary preferences. Lunch often extends through afternoon siesta hours, allowing residents to appreciate the Spanish lifestyle without sacrificing convenience. Healthcare access is exemplary: multiple private clinics employ English-speaking specialists, and Hospital de Dénia provides comprehensive services just 15 minutes away. Cultural life is vibrant—galleries, restaurants serving Michelin-standard cuisine, and seasonal festivals celebrate both Spanish traditions and international events. The sailing community is particularly active, with numerous yacht clubs and water sports facilities. Evening paseos along the seafront combine exercise with social interaction, while restaurants range from casual beachfront chiringuitos to fine-dining establishments. This lifestyle attracts professionals, retirees, and entrepreneurs seeking quality living without compromising international standards.
investmentSection: This villa represents a compelling investment within Javea's appreciating property market. The Costa Blanca has demonstrated 6% year-on-year growth, outperforming broader Spanish residential markets and benefiting from sustained international demand. At €2,900,000, the property is positioned below Javea's €3,200/m² average, suggesting favourable entry valuation. Rental potential adds significant income stability: comparable Javea properties generate €1,400 per week during peak season, translating to substantial annual returns. The property's location in prestigious Portixol—commanding premium rental rates due to exclusivity—positions it above average income expectations. Javea's international expatriate population, combined with thriving yacht tourism and water sports communities, ensures consistent holiday rental demand. The region's stable political environment, EU membership, and transparent property laws provide additional investor confidence. Properties in this category historically appreciate 4-7% annually, while generating 5-8% net rental yields. For discerning investors seeking geographic diversification with tangible income streams, this villa combines residential enjoyment with portfolio appreciation.

lifeAndAmenities.intro: Javea provides exceptional convenience through comprehensive international-standard services, reliable infrastructure, and authentic Mediterranean amenities. Residents enjoy seamless access to healthcare, education, shopping, and transport while maintaining connection to traditional Spanish culture and natural beauty.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in Javea meets the highest European standards. Hospital de Dénia, located 15 minutes away, provides comprehensive facilities including emergency departments, surgical suites, and specialized services. Multiple private clinics throughout Javea employ English-speaking doctors, specialists, and nursing staff trained in British and European protocols. The area attracts retired medical professionals, further elevating healthcare quality. Preventative care is emphasized through numerous wellness centres, physiotherapy clinics, and dental practices catering to international patients. Most expatriates maintain private health insurance, which is accepted at all private facilities. The healthcare infrastructure rivals major European cities while maintaining Spanish efficiency and affordability.

education.text: International education in Javea is exceptional, attracting families from across Europe. Xàbia International College offers British-curriculum education from primary through secondary levels, located conveniently within 7 minutes. Laude Lady Elizabeth, a respected Spanish-British hybrid school, operates 20 minutes away offering Spanish cultural integration with international standards. Both institutions employ experienced expatriate and Spanish educators, fostering multilingual competency. Universities in Valencia and Alicante are accessible for tertiary education, while many families opt for boarding schools in Madrid or Barcelona for advanced study. The educational infrastructure reflects Javea's established expatriate community and family-focused orientation.

shopping.text: Daily shopping combines authentic Spanish markets with international convenience. The Mercado Municipal operates daily with fresh Mediterranean produce, local cheeses, jamón, and seafood direct from morning catches. Mercadona, Consum, and Masymas supermarkets stock both Spanish staples and international products. The British Corner Shop caters specifically to expatriate preferences, stocking UK brands and specialty items. Weekly markets in surrounding towns provide seasonal produce and artisan goods. Shopping centers in Dénia offer fashion, electronics, and variety retail. This blend of traditional and modern shopping creates authentic daily rhythms while maintaining international conveniences.

transport.text: Transportation from Javea is efficient for both daily mobility and international travel. Alicante-Elche Airport, 90 minutes away, operates 150+ daily flights connecting major European cities. Dénia Port, 20 minutes north, provides ferry service to Ibiza and Mallorca, enabling weekend island escapes. Local buses connect Javea to Alicante, Valencia, and regional destinations. Most residents maintain personal vehicles for flexibility; excellent road infrastructure and minimal congestion make driving pleasant. The Mediterranean provides additional transport via established yacht communities and water taxis. This multi-modal connectivity positions Javea as highly accessible while maintaining quiet residential character.
